public class DonationInfoController

    • setUpdate_date

      Parameters:
      update_date - shows the updated date.

    • getLoc

      public void getLoc()
      This function is the getter function of the Locations. Since location is the private attribute so the getter function is necessary here. The catch block is here to handle the exceptions and show then accordingly on the title of the window.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      This is the initializing function of the fxml components. When a the window is launched this method initializes these components. Establishes the connection with the database and upon fetching the data columns works with the property values.
      Overrides:
      initialize in class LogINpanelController

    • pressBack

      public void pressBack​(javafx.event.ActionEvent even) throws java.io.IOException
      Description copied from class: LogINpanelController
      This method is here for the functionality of the "Back" button. This will redirect the user to the parent node that is the "root" which is sample.UserPanel.fxml. This hierarchical structure is for the simplicity of the system.
      Overrides:
      pressBack in class LogINpanelController
      Parameters:
      even -
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException

    • pressSearch

      public void pressSearch​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      This functionality facilitates the searching of the donation records. There are risk of getting null values for some most of the columns in the database which are handled using the if-else blocks. The catch block captures the exceptions in the variable e and displays the string value as the title of the window.
      Parameters:
      event - which is an Object of the ActionEvent

    • pressReset

      public void pressReset​(javafx.event.ActionEvent even) throws java.io.IOException
      Rests the Information of the donations.
      Parameters:
      even - which is an object of the ActionEvent Class
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - checks the i/p and o/p retalted error.
